titleStmt.title: A short suruey of Ireland Truely discouering who it is that hath so armed the hearts of that people with disobedience to their prince. With a description of the countrey, and the condition of the people. No lesse necessarie and needfull to be respected by the English, then requisite and behoouefull to be reformed in the Irish. By Barnabe Rych, Gentleman.
titleStmt.author: Rich, Barnabe, 1540?-1617.

titleStmt.title: A short suruey of Ireland Truely discouering who it is that hath so armed the hearts of that people with disobedience to their prince. With a description of the countrey, and the condition of the people. No lesse necessarie and needfull to be respected by the English, then requisite and behoouefull to be reformed in the Irish. By Barnabe Rych, Gentleman.
titleStmt.author: Rich, Barnabe, 1540?-1617.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by N[icholas] O[kes] for B. Sutton and W. Barenger, and are to be sold at their shop at the great north dore of S. Paules Church,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A suruey of Ireland.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
